title: How to Create Beads Out of Nail Polish

steps.headline: Place a plastic glass or cup on a flat surface.
Pour cold water into the glass.
Add a few drops of the liquid nail polish to the cold water.
Use a skewer or similar item to stir the nail polish in the water.
steps.description: Stir continuously until small balls form in the water.

steps.headline: Check every now and then, while stirring.
steps.description: Eventually some tiny balls will form in the water. These are the nail polish beads.

steps.headline: Remove the nail polish balls from the water.
steps.description: Use tweezers to take them out.

steps.headline: Lay each ball on wax paper on a tray.
steps.description: Repeat the process until you have enough beads.

steps.headline: Use as required.
steps.description: They can be stuck to double-sided tape on jewelry or hair accessories, glued to a drawing or even stuck onto wet nail polish on your nails.

text: Place a plastic glass or cup on a flat surface.  Pour cold water into the glass. Fill it 1/4 of the way. Add a few drops of the liquid nail polish to the cold water.  Use a skewer or similar item to stir the nail polish in the water. Stir continuously until small balls form in the water. Check every now and then, while stirring. Eventually some tiny balls will form in the water. These are the nail polish beads. Remove the nail polish balls from the water. Use tweezers to take them out. Lay each ball on wax paper on a tray. Repeat the process until you have enough beads. Use as required. They can be stuck to double-sided tape on jewelry or hair accessories, glued to a drawing or even stuck onto wet nail polish on your nails.
